intro: Neillia lobata, commonly known as the slender neillia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Neillia lobata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
